full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 410-1 Filed 11/04/21 Page 62 of 93

Statute of Limitations

There is a limit on how much time the Government has to obtain an indictment. Counts Two, Four, Five, and Six are timely—that is, they are not barred by any statute of limitations.

As to Counts One and Three, in order to prove that this prosecution is timely, the Government has to prove that least one of the overt acts in furtherance of that conspiracy involved a victim other than Minor Victim-3[Jane Doe-3 pseudonym]. Put simply: you may not convict the defendant on Counts One or Three solely on the basis of [Jane Doe-3 pseudonym] Minor Victim-3 or an overt act involving [Jane Doe-3 pseudonym]Minor Victim-3.

Adapted from Sand, et al., Modern Federal Jury Instructions, Instr. 19-7.

DOJ-OGR-00006128
